comments.body: I think that some kind of question dialogbox will be nice in this case - this is something that (esp. beginning users) can overlook and this potentially can destroy branches tree.

have you seen the slide in dialog? I think you might have omitted it.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19799111/87808613-506aa680-c85a-11ea-9867-97b27ce56291.png)

It clearly indicates what is to be slide in below what. 
Even though the newbie misses the **bold** parent he/she can easily undo things within (conveniently accessible) machete file. (the word `destroy` is to strong)

Adding the next dialog `Are you sure that you are sure?` is unnecessary.
+ actually the comment about dialog name applies here

Yes, I have seen this dialog, but IMHO if someone will try slide-in branch that is present under other parent this is not something fully intuitive that this branch will be reattached. I mean (esp. in large branch tree) this is simple to accidentally omit already added branch and trying to slide-in it again. But ok, I do not insist, maybe it's just my misconception that the user should be treated as a potential idiot xD

I agree with your **first experience**.

Probably our different expectations (it was @PawelLipski suggestion to reattach) should be considered... :thinking: 
My idea is to add a checkbox (may be enabled by default) for the reattach (simply slide out and slide in without children otherwise). 

This is a candidate for another issue, WDYT?
Yes, checkbox is definitely good idea (maybe even better than messagebox) and yes, this can be candidate for other issue
